comments:
I had my workspace configured to import binary projects that use linked 
resources. In the latest build (I20031216) this no longer works due to the 
following error. It looks like OSGi is looking in workspace for data that is 
atually in my Eclipse install plugins directory. Loading binary plugins 
normally (i.e. copying all contents to the workspace) fixes the problem.

osgi> Cannot install/find: 
reference:file:D:/dev/workspace/org.eclipse.osgi.services/
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: An error occured trying to read the bundle
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.defaultadaptor.DefaultAdaptor$1.begin
(DefaultAdaptor.java:491)
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installWorkerPrivileged
(Framework.java:1005)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework$1.run
(Framework.java:879)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installWorker
(Framework.java:970)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.installBundle
(Framework.java:872)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContext.installBundle
(BundleContext.java:227)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.loadBundles
(EclipseStarter.java:186)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run
(EclipseStarter.java:77)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:741)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:582)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 48816 ***

traces.message: An error occured trying to read the bundle
